document.title: Science Next Generation Sunshine State Standards

DC5935C8834447F6A10B6E0612291DDA.description: Distinguish between a plant and animal.

68131FB859134F42912C18459955EAA0.description: Recognize and respond to one type of sensory stimuli.

0CEFA63AE1B54C4597A37E562A888FFA.description: Distinguish a real animal and an animal that is not a living thing, such as a toy animal.

040BD7978C0947C497124C19D2731E10.description: Recognize the senses of sight and hearing and related body parts.

86D1D89DF9CB4DA2901124B311B8538A.description: Identify differences in characteristics of plants and animals.

C533EC3523DA48298CEBB34E67BFAFB7.description: Identify a behavior of an animal or plant in a book or other media that is not real.

6D6869AC2A7245C7BCF471071556B680.description: Recognize the senses of sight, hearing, and smell and related body parts.

FDBDB3CBB5DB479A88E8EA9CDA59A215.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

D9B9105F4F2446F7946E030FDB746D3C.description: Observe plants and animals, describe how they are alike and how they are different in the way they look and in the things they do.

6D7C404BA9E14451A15A9C6284975591.description: Recognize that some books and other media portray animals and plants with characteristics and behaviors they do not have in real life.

5B66DE5DB098495FAC5F44FF03698213.description: Recognize the five senses and related body parts.

B0C101DB1FCD45A980BA120E8CDEE47B.description: Organization and Development of Living Organisms

9C5193E0F6224EACB47DE041B037E245.description: Track the movement of objects that are pushed or pulled.

99B4E7A035D04261A173B4764BD48D9F.description: Recognize that pushing or pulling an object makes it move.

9AA7D13C8C5146DCB0C4CB71F16CA33C.description: Demonstrate pushing or pulling of an object to make it move.

C5C9AA755AA54B9BBC454BC0C2937015.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

9312C42482B64C49A97862A4BDE1C4FC.description: Observe that a push or a pull can change the way an object is moving.

E0E99D32923C4B2893728570C208DF63.description: Identify ways that things move, such as fast or slow.

665282E68A5D479594CB92268BDCDBBB.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

1B37C44A2F48475EA0B3EC97963E314A.description: Investigate that things move in different ways, such as fast, slow, etc.

285DC2C62F0340DEB3575288488340A2.description: Recognize and respond to common sounds.

8736CA74127143B6AEAA3289FF1A5805.description: Identify objects that create specific sounds.

FC7EDFA7FC7A402F8A809FEE0C36D07A.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

9A2DC28E8BFF4F4CA2E901A8C27A8B22.description: Observe that things that make sound vibrate.

52218454C2204A75B9DF8742819BD539.description: Recognize a change in an object.

6655B05B92E34B6C8E27A5F238EA861B.description: Recognize that the shape of objects, such as paper, changes when cut or torn.

4AB219E3CD0C428691B97D02BD0C3D25.description: Recognize that the shape of objects, such as paper, changes when cut, torn, or crumpled.

442BA6862865465598C74A0B003516B3.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

076A1EA01B3746A99451B6DDC262A7D8.description: Recognize that the shape of materials such as paper and clay can be changed by cutting, tearing, crumpling, smashing, or rolling.

85D7C45350EA4FBF90C6D33F8D5CCBDC.description: Recognize two common objects that are identical to each other.

207FFA54CAD74F669BEF89346F0F23C8.description: Match objects by an observable property, such as size or color.

674C47E7D11948F6B72CFE6BF927E823.description: Sort objects by observable properties, such as size, shape, or color.

7FEFB7CB285D415798F99F7BA2603B5B.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

288AEF0CB2D04615A42E37FEC3ADC1C2.description: Sort objects by observable properties, such as size, shape, color, temperature (hot or cold), weight (heavy or light) and texture.

FD9024587A6E4B879B89C35EC593A66C.description: Recognize one common activity that occurs during the day.

A5BB3538076249D9AE499E4C3818F7C2.description: Recognize familiar objects that are far away or nearby.

8A3DA4BC3E7D4D508D68643D6EA3489A.description: Recognize the size of items as either big or small.

9947BFE222824C63B3830BCB853B2AFA.description: Recognize the Moon in the sky at night.

85E2EFA369DB49C49ABBD87C42B6DB5D.description: Recognize the Sun in the daytime.

0328984117D3400FBC06189036B9CF58.description: Identify one common activity that occurs in the day and one that occurs in the night.

8B125A352A2045689E48A56ECE92DAAD.description: Recognize that objects fall to the ground.

CF4663AFEE4F4CA58CA4B35CE005DF17.description: Identify an item that is far away and an item that is nearby.

BFC423568F6347E582AD08C6E11017DC.description: Observe big and small things in the sky.

406F4AAD3B624A46827B711E49AC6A23.description: Identify the Moon in the sky at night.

FD7F419E92934FB492489439DEE07C27.description: Identify the Sun in the daytime.

C1FEB3EC6E2644289DD44867F26602E2.description: Identify daily activities in a 24-hour period, such as eating breakfast and going to bed, and associate activities with morning and night.

FAFD6387DE514EA2B74FF96C8232FC02.description: Identify that objects can fall to the ground unless something stops them.

74FC32B55063431997DE53B4BADC5965.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

EFBC523DC38B47149644A39541CDCEB7.description: Observe that some objects are far away and some are nearby as seen from Earth.

3EF6FBD5270D414D99D60B1D6109BDB3.description: Observe that things can be big and things can be small as seen from Earth.

722DE77FCEE4437BB493A864651936F8.description: Observe that sometimes the Moon can be seen at night and sometimes during the day.

E2FE0C212FEA40C6AB3EB63C0A8AD085.description: Recognize that the Sun can only be seen in the daytime.

961577EFF24E4D18B07B9CDD33F833D6.description: Recognize the repeating pattern of day and night.

101960C4068F44D99120885331018B53.description: Explore the Law of Gravity by investigating how objects are pulled toward the ground unless something holds them up.

8DBC0B135B4C4E63A7FC7B07D97B643D.description: Recognize common objects in the natural world through observation.

76340C22ABAF45CD8BC75B26436485A0.description: Observe, explore, and match pictures to real objects.

54ECCE5A413044B0818EDC551696A906.description: Identify information about objects in the natural world through observation.

D961829E3A7646118C14ECF9DF1FFF90.description: Collect a designated item with a partner.

6D6164AE6C8B40C483FCB23DA21DE946.description: Observe, explore, and create a visual representation of real objects.

D44E25F24EA7404E9E43DC050FD2BECF.description: Identify information about objects and actions in the natural world through observation.

81DFB61AC0B848688FCFCF8DF870AAD1.description: Identify a partner to obtain information.

7B8DBD4935C74AB199B4D3FB27242C8E.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

E83D1B0876EE468B80F94A7073B39D55.description: Recognize that learning can come from careful observation.

CA08191A89934D23A4063E654F0A3748.description: Observe and create a visual representation of an object which includes its major features.

08AFE953120E48109B10448690BEF196.description: Keep records as appropriate -- such as pictorial records -- of investigations conducted.

12E72B29FED74A3BA4DFC301521C2E84.description: Make observations of the natural world and know that they are descriptors collected using the five senses.

1EA2A1D591F043B1A0FEED78317E441B.description: Collaborate with a partner to collect information.
